p: The most abundant fatty acids of L. kerstingii seed oil were oleic (38.45%) and palmitic (33.20%) acids followed by linoleic (12.75%) and stearic (7.43%) acids, which together comprised 91.83% of the total fatty acid. The fatty acid composition of L. kerstingii seed oil was comparable to that of palm oil and like that one, the L. kerstingii seed oil can be regarded as an oleic-palmitic oil [20]. Therefore, L. kerstingii seed oil can be considered as an alternative to palm oil in food industries.
